scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In this collection, Richard Le Gallienne writes to a Miss Collins, February 10, 1930, regretting her departure and enclosing a fair copy of "A Caravan from China (A Paraphrase from Hafiz)."

did.unittitle: A Fair Copy of "A Caravan from China (A Paraphrase from Hafiz)" in Richard Le Gallienne's hand n.d.

scopecontent.p: Enclosed with a letter described below.

did.unittitle: Richard Le Gallienne, Menton, France, to Miss Collins, Bordighera, Italy 1930 Feb 10

scopecontent.p: Sends a copy of "A Caravan from China" in his hand and expresses his regret at her leaving, "We shall often think of the brave English girl all alone in the haunted washes of Thibet--with that terrible toothache too!"
